description: Italians are a versatile civilization that can excel at naval warfare and gunpowder units.
dark_age: Start with 6 villagers and a scout.
Build a house, a dock near fish, and a lumber camp near forests.
Train additional villagers from the town center.
Use the scout to explore the map and find resources.
Advance to Feudal Age at around 22-23 minutes with 500 food and 200 gold.
Have around 1000-1200 food, 150-200 wood, and 150-200 gold at the end of the Dark Age.
Assign 6-7 villagers to food, 2-3 to wood, 1-2 to gold, and 2-3 to stone.
feudal_age: Build additional fishing ships and start fishing for food.
Build a market and blacksmith to upgrade units and sell excess resources for gold.
Train archers and skirmishers from the archery range.
Advance to Castle Age at around 28-29 minutes with 800 food and 400 gold.
Have around 1500-1800 food, 600-800 wood, 500-600 gold, and 300-400 stone at the end of the Feudal Age.
Assign 10-12 villagers to food, 6-7 to wood, 3-4 to gold, and 4-5 to stone.
castle_age: Build a second town center and start training villagers.
Train crossbowmen and upgrade them to arbalests.
Build a university and start researching ballistics and chemistry for improved gunpowder unit performance.
Advance to Imperial Age at around 34-35 minutes with 1000 food, 1000 gold, and 800 stone.
Have around 3000-3500 food, 2000-2500 wood, 1200-1500 gold, and 600-800 stone at the end of the Castle Age.
Assign 20-25 villagers to food, 10-12 to wood, 8-10 to gold, and 8-10 to stone.
imperial_age: Research the unique technology, Pavise, for improved archer and infantry performance.
Train Genoese Crossbowmen to counter enemy cavalry units.
Build bombard cannons and train hand cannoneers for a strong gunpowder unit composition.
Have a balanced economy with enough food and wood for unit production, and enough gold for technology research and unit upgrades.
Assign 35-40 villagers to food, 20-25 to wood, 16-20 to gold, and 10-12 to stone.
